title: How to Draw a Stick Horse

steps.headline: Set up the drawing space.
steps.description: You will need a smooth, hard surface, pencil (with eraser), and a sheet of paper.

steps.headline: Draw a rectangle in the center of the paper (you'll need room for the neck and legs).
Draw a line (a bit longer than half the rectangle lengthwise) coming out of either top corner, at any angle (depending on what your horse is doing.
steps.description: This is the neck. If your horse is grazing, have it curved down (don't forget to leave space for the head!). If your horse is running flat-out, you'll want the neck almost horizontal, but slanted a bit upwards. If your horse is standing, you'll want the neck at about a 45° degree angle.

steps.headline: Draw a long and fairly skinny rectangle coming off the neck.
Add the eye, nostril, ears, and mane.
steps.description:
Optional: Add eyelashes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f2\/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f2\/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Draw the legs.
steps.description: The faster the horse is running, the more far out their legs will need to be angled. If the horse is standing, they should be vertical.

steps.headline: Draw the tail.
steps.description:
Start with the main line, then add approximately 4-6 lines branching off it as shown. Enjoy your stick horse, and feel free to color it, or add a background. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/40\/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/40\/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

text:
Set up the drawing space. You will need a smooth, hard surface, pencil (with eraser), and a sheet of paper. Draw a rectangle in the center of the paper (you'll need room for the neck and legs). This is the horse's torso. Draw a line (a bit longer than half the rectangle lengthwise) coming out of either top corner, at any angle (depending on what your horse is doing. This is the neck. If your horse is grazing, have it curved down (don't forget to leave space for the head!). If your horse is running flat-out, you'll want the neck almost horizontal, but slanted a bit upwards. If your horse is standing, you'll want the neck at about a 45° degree angle. Draw a long and fairly skinny rectangle coming off the neck. This is your horse's head. Add the eye, nostril, ears, and mane. Optional: Add eyelashes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Draw the legs. The faster the horse is running, the more far out their legs will need to be angled. If the horse is standing, they should be vertical. Draw the tail. Start with the main line, then add approximately 4-6 lines branching off it as shown. Enjoy your stick horse, and feel free to color it, or add a background. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Draw-a-Stick-Horse-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
